column4: And rorry if some applications say they are designed for KDE will they still run on GNOME?
Like the KDE task manager for example.
So if I have the libaries it will function perfectly?
but to run I just need kdelivs
And out of curiosity why did you put compile in *'s
Oh I have a question do
do I need to use su even when im using the account I installed linux with?
And does the account I installed ubuntu with already have root privelages?
sudo gives your user root power
gksu is the graphical version of sudo
someone anwsered you about it make sure gdm doesn't start on boot
yes alt-ctrl-f2 will take you to the console then do sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop
if you want it permant you just have to chmod -x /etc/init.d/gdm
vim then press insert then type then press esc then :wq to save and quit vimtutor will help you out more
